title: Understanding Dengue Fever: Prevention and Treatment
summary: Learn about dengue symptoms, how it spreads, and essential prevention measures to protect your family.
content:
What is Dengue Fever?

Dengue fever is a mosquito-borne viral infection that causes flu-like symptoms and can develop into severe dengue, which can be life-threatening. The disease is transmitted primarily by Aedes aegypti mosquitoes.

Symptoms

  • High fever (104°F/40°C)
  • Severe headache
  • Pain behind the eyes
  • Joint and muscle pain
  • Nausea and vomiting
  • Skin rash

Prevention

The best way to prevent dengue is to avoid mosquito bites:

  • Use mosquito repellent
  • Wear long sleeves and pants
  • Remove standing water around your home
  • Use mosquito nets while sleeping
  • Install window screens

Treatment

There is no specific treatment for dengue fever. Management focuses on:

  • Rest and hydration
  • Pain relievers (acetaminophen, NOT aspirin)
  • Monitoring for warning signs of severe dengue
  • Seeking immediate medical care if symptoms worsen

When to Seek Emergency Care

Contact a healthcare provider immediately if you experience:

  • Severe abdominal pain
  • Persistent vomiting
  • Bleeding from nose or gums
  • Blood in urine or stool
  • Difficulty breathing
  • Extreme fatigue or restlessness
author: Dr. Rahman Ahmed
